1232111111.title: Go to the villiage

choices: They go to a school to discover new powers
They take a strange request from the questboard
They research unique items and loot
13.content:
A group of five men had finally been able to form a party together after having worked solo for a majority of their career. While they certainly not weak, they had plans to get even stronger and were willing to do anything to accomplish it.

David, the knight, was the charismatic leader of the group. Even when equipped with a sturdy shield, he still was very fast and agile. But he wanted to get even faster and his weakness to elemental attacks frustrated him when he was in a pinch.

Arther, the mage, was the brains of the operation. His massive spells and analytical skills were second to none, however this often left him at a disadvantage to his more feral opponents and he was currently researching methods to defend himself from physical attacks.

Harry, the archer, was the wise cracking sniper. Though a bit of a lech, his accuracy was above 90%. Though he regularly made use of tools to get out of dangerous confrontations, Creatures like the undead were always tricky to shake off.

Samuel, the healer, was a man of god which while made him a great healer and a compassionate man, he was good for little else really. The only other talent the man held to his name was his cooking but his lack of sense of humor and poor fighting skills put him a real bind with the rest of the group.

Gore, the Beserker, was a brutish man through and through. When it came to direct conflict, he not only relished in it, he excelled in it. He was, however, a very crass and tactless man. His antics and desire to fight often got the group in more fights than necessary and put him at odds with the others.

The group argued for hours about what they would do become stronger eventually settling on lots from hat, drawn by a local woman passing by.
13.title: The Ultimate Power!

choices: David, looking to stop his weakness to elemental magic
Gore, about to take a blow to his pride
131.content:
After hours of arguing, the group decided the fastest way to improve at the moment would be to find some way to compensate for or negate their weaknesses. Gore initially scoffed at the idea but the idea of getting even stronger was enough of a hook to get him to agree to attend the Grand Institute for Resolute Leaders, a premier school that has detailed information and studies into all known fields of work and combat. The school was formerly an all girls school, with the words 'Leaders' formerly being 'Ladies' until a few years ago.

It took them a while to get to the Institute, and even longer to get through all the paperwork (since Gore couldn't read) but they were finally permitted to use the facilities and participate in the courses at the school. As soon as they had the chance, they were moving about the place looking for ways to overcome the weaknesses or at the very least boost their skills.

Who shall we be following first?
131.title: They go to a school to discover new powers

choices: David is given a seemingly menial task
David is treated strangely by Ms. Sterling
1311.content:
David figured the school would be filled with expert magi and witches, people who could offer him some real solutions to his problem with the elements. It was here heard of Miss Henriet Sterling, an accomplished Witch of the Four Elements who owned a private study on campus. She would be the perfect person for his problem.

He rushed there to be met with a tall observation tower that stood next to a plentiful garden. David intrepidly knocked on the door... nothing. Then once more, with gusto, he soon heard faint footsteps approach and open the door. "Yes?" the old woman squeaked, her pitch matching sound of the creaking wooden door. "What can I do for you?"

The woman had a long nose and a friendly smile, her robes well-worn but also well-maintained, the additional layers of cloth denoting her rank and practice clearly. "Hello, Professor Sterling. My name is David and I have been having trouble with elemental magic and was hoping to receive your expertise in how to deal with it."

"Hmm, you want me to instruct you. I haven't taught for a number of years and certainly not to one so old or... well, the times are changing, but you must understand the training will change you, yes?"

David thought that was a weird question, "Of course, all training is a means of changing oneself for the better!"

"Alright, but since you are already a knight, you'll need to wear this at all times until your training is complete." She then gave David a ruby red brooch with gold filigree with a pink bow underneath.

"Is it magical?"

"Oh yes, it will allow you to train skills and attributes that would otherwise be impossible for a knight."

What David didn't realize was Miss Henriet Sterling was known for a specific kind of teaching: The development of young magical girls.
1311.title: David, looking to stop his weaknesses

choices: Elize picks the maid subclass for Gore
Elize picks the cheerleader subclass for Gore
1312.content:
Gore began wandering around the school aimlessly. He wasn't really sure what to do. After some time and guided from students he found himself looking at a list of classes to take some. Gore had to pick some subclass to take along with his strength training. However his inability to read meant he had no idea what he was looking at.

Gore was struggling to keep his cool as he had no idea what to do. Finally he figured he would just have to swallow his pride and leave the thinking to someone else. Gore picked out a nearby female student and asked her to pick a subclass for him.

The girl carefully examined Gore taking in everything. Even at a glance she had figured him out pretty well. She thought to herself how berserkers were stubborn, selfish, and rash. The girl named Elize saw this as a great chance to straighten out Gore before he did anything reckless and stupid at the academy.
1312.title: Gore, about to take a blow to his pride

choices: Edelweiss overpowers Gore with Maid skills
13121.content:
Just from what little she had interacted with this brutish looking man, Elize decided he need to learn some manners and respect. The way he had bade her to pick a subclass for him left a bitter taste in her mouth and she wanted to teach him a lesson. So she glanced through the list of classes and their teachers, trying to find the perfect place to straighten him out. Then, she spotted it: Ms. Edelweiss and her rigorous Maid Training course, a perfect destination for Gore. Elize, with straight face and utmost sincerity, turned to Gore and pointed to the course, "This Class is perfect for you." She spoke calmly and clearly. "The teacher's name is Ms. Edelweiss and the class takes place in room 3410 in the big White building over there." She directed purposefully using smaller words to direct him. She then took out a piece of paper and wrote 3410 on it, just in case, "Look for a room, that has the same numbers as this on it in this order. It should be easy." Gore took the piece of paper and stared at it for a second, then waved Elize off as he left for the Class. 'Rude to the end.' She thought in a huff as she left for her class.

Gore moved to the white building and then through each floor, slowly glancing at each of the room numbers until eventually he found the room 3410 that he was looking for. Gore opened the door to find a middle aged woman with grayish hair and a step-mother like scowl on her face, there were several woman sitting at desks in front of her. The middle aged woman looked at Gore and raised an eyebrow at his entrance. Gore, however, took this as a challenge and confidently walked in, "I was told the class would be perfect for me." He grunted with a primal snort.

The middle-aged woman, still stone-faced, spoke, "Quite. Well, perhaps you were told that for any number of reasons but if you intend to stay then I will be your teacher, my name is Ms. Edelweiss. In order to finalize your decision and take this course you will need to take on the Maid Sub Class to begin my training. Are you prepared to do so?" She explained coldly and succinctly.

The young women in the room looked on at Gore with worry and concern that he would do something rash or dangerous. But, Gore took Edelweiss's tone as a challenge, he would not bend so easily, especially not to woman. "I am always ready, for I am strong." Gore boasted.

"Very well. Take this crystal." Edelweiss continued showing a silvery gem. "And crush it in your hand."

"A simple challenge." Gore smiled as he took the gem in his palm and closes his hand, quickly turning it to dust. A soft energy began to enter Gore's body, he was a bit disappointed by it. The women behind him whispered behind seeing this, unsure what to make of it.

"Very good. Now take a seat so we may begin."

"Why should I follow your orders? I only take orders from those who are stronger than me and I have never met anyone who could. I've played your game now show me your power." Gore demanded, what little patience he had wearing thin as he began itch for a fight.

The women gasped and became worried while Edelweiss let out a deep sigh, "Sp I have another rowdy one this year too?"
13121.title: Elize picks the maid subclass for Gore

131212.content:
Gore decided to test how powerful Edelweiss was by trying to punch her after increasing his strength with one of his berserker skills. The other women in the class tried to avert their eyes as the attack landed. To Gore's surprise though the attack did nothing to Ms. Edelweiss who dusted off her clothes from the attack. "Why did it not hurt you?" He asked in confusion and shock.

"Maids are not meant to attack their superiors. Now that you have the maid subclass your attack drastically weakens when you try to attack someone of higher status than you such as myself," Gore was shocked by her words but wasn't going to let that stop him. He used the berserker skill 'mad frenzy' to relentlessly attack her some more. However each blow amounted to nothing but agitating Edelweiss further."I have dealt with many an unruly student and each one learned their place eventually. And you will be no different." Suddenly Ms. Edelweiss began to use a high class maid skill on Gore. All of her cleaning and serving skills had given her incredible dexterity. Using this she danced around him and gave a very special massage.

"W-why do I feel so weird?" Gore wanted to fight but his body refused to. It began to relax before going entirely limp. Edelweiss placed him down in a chair where he could barely move let alone fight.

"The first and most important part of being a maid is that a maid always obeys and serves without question. You will have this drilled into your head by the time we are finished." The other girls couldn't help but laugh at Gore's humiliating defeat. Being defeated and mocked like this was a huge blow to his pride. Even so he swore to himself that he would rise to the challenge and not let this woman beat him in the end.
131212.title: Edelweiss overpowers Gore with Maid skills

choices: Edelweiss instructs Gore and teaches him to read
Edelweiss reads to Gore and makes tea for him
1312121.content:
Edelweiss faced forward toward the class in a snap, her skirt fluttering as she did so, as she clapped her hands together to get the classes attention, “Now, now. I do not want to hear you laughing at your colleague. That can be an even graver sin a maid could commit compared what this man attempted.” She warned sternly. “Now can anyone tell me why that is? You, miss…”

“Ah, um, Loretta Davis, ma’am.” The blonde woman responded with a slight stammer as she attempted to readjust her glasses.

“Miss Loretta, can you explain to the class why laughing at a colleague is worse for a maid to do than a bout of disobedience?”

The woman was confused, “I’m sorry, I don’t know the answer.”

Edelweiss let out a sigh, “Very well. I shall explain. The reason is a maid’s misbehavior can be forgiven and fixed quickly. However, if a maid shows little respect for her fellow maids, then how can she be expected to show the respect and reverence for her superiors and her orders that are required of her? That, my dear students, is far greater problem for a maid to possess. Maids share a unique devotion and respect to their craft, it is this devotion that allows us to serve the lords and ladies that employ us while also helping us protect them from the evil surrounding them and extinguish the malice inside their hearts. I want you all to keep this in mind as we continue your training.” Gore listened unwillingly as his body continued to refuse his commands, unable to move from the chair as the effects of Edelweiss’s massage continued. “Regardless, Today’s class is mainly an introduction of things to come. You have all received your Maid subclass and the reading material had been provided for you. You are expected to read all of it by tomorrow, were you will be given your maid uniform’s and we will properly begin your training regarding manners and posture. You are all dismissed for today, be sure to arrive at class by 9 in the morning.”

The young woman all rose from their seats and trickled out of the classroom one by one, leaving only Gore and Edelweiss. “Now then, mister…”

“Gore!” His nostrils flared as his anger boiled over.

Still, her face showed no change, “…Quite. Now then Gore, judging from your attitude and actions you seem confused as to your predicament. However, as of now you are a maid under my tutelage and unlike your colleagues who have already left, you will need extra special attention to make sure you keep up and not cause harm or embarrassment to your fellow maids or lord or lady you will eventually serve. So, let me start off with some questions: What do you want out of life?” Edelweiss stared at Gore as he angrily snarled incoherently at her. “Money, Women, Power. Greed, Lust and Wrath. Well, we can take of that in time. Next, what are your strengths?” She stared once again. “Just good at fighting. A tepid berserker, aren’t you?” Edelweiss spoke fast and fluidly, using an advanced vocabulary that Gore lacked. “Hmm, Lastly, can you read?” Her last question took him off guard and, briefly, his expression changed to surprise. “So, you can’t? Well Gore that would make this reading assignment impossible for you. Very well, I shall instruct you on the reading assignment personally and then teach you how to read.” Edelweiss concluded as she moved to pick up the small book containing the readings. Finally Gore was beginning to regain control of his wrist and fingers but little else.
1312121.title: Edelweiss begins the lesson

choices: Edelweiss magically teaches Gore against his will
13121211.content:
“Reading is for weak—“ Gore was snapped out of his furious snarl by the unexpected sensation of a book tapping against his forehead. Edelweiss had somehow managed to cross the entirety of the room in the space of a single blink. Gore’s rage subsided for a split second to be replaced with awe at this woman’s speed. It soon reappeared, however, as the tapping grew stronger and he found himself unable to so much as lift a hand to stop the pain.

“Your mistake, Mr. Gore, is rudimentary. You are afraid.”

As the Berserker began to roar his disagreement, Edelweiss’s free hand shot to his throat, The contact felt like the gentlest caress, but the effects were obvious. Gore strained against his useless muscles, spittle flying as he tried to roar out in explosive disagreement. All that came out was a guttural, strangled wheeze.

“Yes, afraid. You hide from true strength, from improvement. The very thought of the unfamiliar turns a man who bathes in blood into a coward that hides behind his blustering pride.”

Gore glared at Ms. Edelweiss with a rage that would break any weaker will. Ms. Edelweiss merely stared back in kind, face as composed and unreadable as stone. She tapped his head again, harder this time to make sure the point was made, and then lowered the book away from his head.

“Mr. Gore, are you a strong man?” Edelweiss stared at her newest pupil with something close to distaste flashing in her eyes. Gore nodded his head the slightest fraction of a centimeter, all he was able to do. His returning glare made the message clear.

“Good. You will need strength for what comes next. You can no longer solve your problems with brute force. No amount of howling or abuse will convince this to share its secrets.” Edelweiss opened the book with a single hand, flipping through its pages with her thumb.

Moving closer to her pupil, Edelweiss drew a chair up next to Gore to sit down with a delicacy that belied her power. Gore’s fingers twitched as he continued his futile straining to attack and maim as he always had before. Edelweiss laid her hands on his, messaging hiss knuckles for the smallest fraction of a second, and then only his eye were left able to move.

“I need you to focus now, Mr. Gore. Observe.” Edelweiss opened the book to a woodcut illustration, pointing with one perfectly manicured finger to direct her pupil’s attention. Gore stared at the page, eyes slowly losing their fury as he gazed into the artwork.

A young woman stood expressionless with perfect, submissive posture. Wearing a simple dress of pure black, accented with frills and lace designs of a lighter color, the woman held a tray of assorted fine wines and gourmet dishes. A smiling man, dressed in the unmistakable extravagance of aristocracy, sat in a throne-like chair just to her right, feet kicked up on an ornate stool.

“This is the essence of our profession. The act of serving. Selfless, humbling, at times even nearing slavery. A maid is not bothered by this. She understands that it is through sacrifice that the goal is accomplished. The goal of all maids, that is. The happiness of the master. The satisfaction of the mistress. It is through this that order is maintained, that all is right.”

Gore stared at his teacher with a gaze boiling with disdain. A warrior has no concern for the actions and doings of his servants. Why in all the Hells was this woman telling Gore all this? This could not help him smash skulls, nor could he use this to better dominate the weaker beings that surrounded him.

Edelweiss did not ignore her pupil’s stare. Lips tightening, she tapped her finger back on the illustration of the woman to grasp his attention.

“This, Mr. Gore, is you.”

Gore strained once more against his own body in his urge to rip this woman into shreds. He was no servant. No maid. No lowly, begging bitch. He tried to spit on Edelweiss, but the drool only caught in his frozen mouth and dribbled down his chin. Edelweiss cleaned him before continuing, patting down his mouth with a handkerchief as she sighed.

“We have much work to do. We must begin at once. I do not enjoy teaching one in a few hours what others learn over years, even with the aid of magic. This will take some time. And, I’m afraid, it will very likely be painful. Time to prove you are strong, Mr. Gore.”
13121211.title: Edelweiss instructs Gore and teaches him to read

13123.content:
What subclass does Eliza trick Gore into permanently joining?

Is it The Coquette?

The grandmistress of flirtation and the queen of toying with affection, the Coquette is a subclass that requires a mind as sharp as it is lewd, a silver tongue (and the knowledge of proper usage), and a willingness to use everything in one’s possession to achieve goals. Although many never reveal it, all Coquettes possess a limited but powerful magical ability to compliment and augment their natural powers of beauty, seduction, and persuasion. Coquettes use these abilities, their uniquely extravangt fashion senses, the power of their direct flirtation, and an occasionally primal sensuality (among many other tools) to capture the attention of whomever they please.

In combat, a Coquette keeps their target too distracted to be effective, often placing herself in danger to maximize the distraction and give herself the chance to seduce her opponent and remove them from the fight completely. As such, a Coquette requires proper teamwork to survive most combat situations, healing her when an opponent ignores her advances and attacks, or saving her when an opponent responds to her minxish wooing with more excitement and enthusiasm than expected.

Out of combat, a Coquette truly shines. Using their carefully created beauty to lure and tease their targets into doing almost anything imaginable, a skilled Coquette can create allies over a single night, topple local administration, or even go her entire life without paying for a drink. At best, a Coquette is a force of nature, a paragon of temptation that can do as they please at the cost of everyone save themselves. At worst, even the least talented Coquette possesses the supernatural abilities that allow her to make good on the class’s reputation.

As with many subclasses, Coquettes have choices in specialization. The Path of the Nymph, inspired by the nature spirits famous for their unattainable affections and untouchable beauty, teaches its followers that nothing is more powerful than frustrated desire. The abilities gained from this path reflect this philosophy, giving a Coquette powerful options to bring attention to herself while simultaneously being a nigh-unattainable target. Those that find that they work best in crowds, are considered adorable, and prefer to seduce from afar with a focus on teasing rather than actual contact often follow this path. The Path of the Seductress, born from the long history of the courtesan and the “working girl”, teaches its followers how to utilize the power of movement, temptation, and desire to completely enrapture their targets and remove them from reality to the realm of pure lust. The abilities gained from this path reflect this philosophy, giving a Coquette powerful options to control and stimulate their targets to the point of changing threats into tools. Those that find that they work best with single targets, easily seduce even the stoic, and prefer to seduce up close and personal until their target is left helpless with desire.
13123.title: More options

131232.content:
What subclass does Elize trick Gore into permanently joining?

Is it The Danseuse?

The essence of grace, a symbol of uplifting elegance and beauty to her comrades, the Danseuse is a subclass for those who desire to use their physical abilities to inspire others onto greatness while harness the power of psychic-magic to make the world more beautiful. Utilizing their own psychic energies to turn their ornate and complex dances into rallying cries for their allies, the Danseuse is an expert who has specialized in a single field to the point of awe-inspiring perfection. Danseuse, by utilizing both their physical dexterity and grace in conjunction with their internal psychic beauty, utilize their ascetic dedication to their craft to make the world a truly beautiful and good place.

A Danseuse takes a psychic pledge to never willingly directly cause harm or death, allowing her to access the deep wells of positive energy that rest inside her ritually prepared soul. As such, they take a strictly support-based role while in combat. Using her dance to make allies powerful beyond nearly any other class’s ability, a Danseuse is a force multiplier for whatever group is lucky enough to have her. However, she is likewise an extremely fragile combatant that can only hope to have time to make a magic-assisted retreat from any threats that slip past her teammates.

Outside of combat, a Danseuse has great freedom in how she can achieve her goals. Driven to make the world a better and more beautiful place through their permanently binding pledge, a Danseuse’s first priority in any interaction is to use her beauty to bring hope to others. As such, many Danseuse spend the majority of their time either doing good deeds and giving away any wealth they’ve accumulated (Danseuse require very little in way of equipment), or performing in public to any crowds they can find. Such performances are very popular, as they have a psychically positive impact that can last for quite some time.

As with many subclasses, Danseuse have choices in specialization. The Prima Rose Style, taught to those Danseuse who show great psychic skill and ego strength, is inspired by the beauty of the rose and the striking elegance of the lead dancer. This style provides its users with several unique dances and techniques, giving them the ability to temporarily stun opponents with displays of awe-inspiring grace, provide allies with psychic powers that improve their greatest strengths, and even bend the rules of space and time with pure psychic willpower. Those who are confident in their ability to display beauty and utilize their inner beauty to improve the world often dedicate themselves to this style. The Tulle Lily Style, taught to those who show the greatest level of delicacy and grace in their movement and psychic expression, is inspired by the grace of the meek and the martyrdom of the innocent. The users of this style focus completely on those who their dances effect, providing even stronger offensive and defensive support effects while creating psychic auras of peace where opponents and allies alike are unable to cause harm. Those who seek above all else to save and to protect, using the perfect grace and delicacy of their movement to turn beauty into a shield, often dedicate their lives to the mastery of this style.

It is NOT recommended for heroes who have begun their careers as warriors or any combat-based class to enter the Danseuse class as the majority of their skills and abilities become useless. Likewise, emotion-based effects such as a berserker’s frenzy or a bloodrager’s bloodrage are permanently inaccessible while a Danseuse (not, of course, that any such hero would ever willingly become a Danseuse) as a result of their pledge.
131232.title: More options

1312322.content:
What subclass does Elize trick Gore into permanently joining?

Is it The Sweetheart?

Prancing and skipping into battle with a high-pitched cry of professed love and romance, the Sweetheart cuts an unmistakable figure even among the varied ranks of heroes and adventurers. A subclass for those have dedicated their lives to the pure power of love and the complicated magics that revolve around this force, it is synonymous with the joy, romance, and endless playfulness that gives them their name. Undergoing intensive training to connect to the oft-ignored unique energies of love magic, Sweethearts use their enthusiasm to foster the love and desire that is the underpinning of the world. From their often outlandish fashion to their unique song-and-dance based methods of professing and encouraging love, Sweethearts dedicate themselves to lovemaking and the furthering of romance.

In combat, a Sweetheart will always be found doing something that might at first be construed as counter-productive—making love, not war. However, as the allies of Sweethearts can attain, they are often so skilled at this task that the enemy is so distracted any allies have an opportunity to sweep them off their feet (so to speak). In addition, love magic has an extremely wide variety of uses, including extremely powerful healing, defensive augmentation, and rendering combatants useless by manipulating romance and affection.

Outside of combat, the Sweetheart is an agent of love. Their immediate priority in any interaction is to encourage the other being to love as fully and positively as possible. This often leads to awkward situations where the Sweetheart is the target of affections, but Sweethearts are enlightened and see these merely as opportunities to generate more love (opportunities they always selflessly pursue). Using their magic and inherent charisma to encourage love and adoration for one another, Sweethearts are often found in populated areas leading impromptu parties and hosting unannounced concerts. These can often dissolve into purely bacchanal parties, but so long as love is had and harm is avoided, a Sweetheart does not necessarily have any issue with that.

As with many subclasses, Sweethearts have choices in specialization. The Inamorata Idol Heart, a type of love magic ritual training taught to those who focus on expressing love through their performing talents, is deeply tied to the primal affecting power of love as expressed through music and movement. This training enables Sweethearts to utilize their love magic to simultaneously affect multiple targets with different effects, allowing for greater battlefield control, as well as greatly improving their ability to encourage large crowds to feel the power of love and adoration during performances. Sweethearts who view themselves as a conduit for love to reach the entire world often are drawn towards this path. The Moonbeam Amor Heart is a type of ancient love magic ritual training taught since the discovery of love magic to those who focus on the power and energy of true, wild love between individuals (and the situations and emotions that encourage such love). This training intensifies a Sweetheart’s natural Romance Aura, causing them to effect enemies more strongly with their attacks, and enables them to better control the psychic element of love magic. Sweethearts who are focused on ensuring that they facilitate true and powerful love are often drawn to this path.
1312322.title: Something Else

13123222.content:
What subclass does Elize trick Gore into permanently joining?

Is it The Fairy Princess?

Whether they are curtseying before an emperor and bringing smiles to his entire court, or standing before a Great Wyrm and using their magic wand to save the lives of their comrades, the Fairy Princess is in equal parts a symbol of adorable purity and moral righteousness. A subclass for those who are willing to shoulder the responsibility and the restrictions of the Fairy Princess Pact to use powerful and ancient Fae magic to protect allies and fight for goodness, the Fairy Princess is the image of proper, ladylike righteousness. Born of the ancient Elven traditions of Fae Pacts, Fairy Princesses make personal pacts with extremely powerful Fairies, giving up a portion of their free will and agreeing to a list of conditions that they are permanently bound to. In return, the Fairy becomes their Wardmother, an omnipresent guardian and the source of their power. Under this protection, the bonded being becomes a Fairy Princess, fighting for the specific issues agreed upon in their Pact with absolute determination.

Fairy Princesses do not actually control their powers, but during the initial pact writing they discuss how the Fae magic will manifest. In many senses, the Fairy Princess is little more than a vessel for Fae influence. Fae magic requires physical elements, or “fairy heirlooms” (such as wands, tiaras, etcetera), to be activated. As such, Fairy Princess are famous for the complicated, regal, and irremovable costumes they wear (normally created by the Fae as part of the Pact), which normally transform and grow even more extravagant during the usage of more powerful Fae magics. During combat, a Fairy Princess will use her magic as the Pact commands, normally to confuse or immobilize foes while protecting and supporting allies. Fae magic is very powerful, but as a Princess has no direct control over it the results can be unpredictable.

Outside of combat, Fairy Princesses are normally able to converse with their Fae benefactor whenever they need to achieve a specific goal through magic (otherwise pursuing mundane ends). In most situations, a Fairy Princess is going to be bound by her pact to act in a certain manner. Even when otherwise, she will still be compelled to follow the general philosophy of the pact. The nature of a Fairy Princess Pact can vary widely, but there are always a few guarantees: they will always act a Princess, they will always save the innocent, and they will never commit an evil act. More specific focuses, from fashion to sword-fighting, will determine how a Fairy Princess is driven to interact with others.

As with many subclasses, Fairy Princesses have choices in specialization. The Queensguard, a group of like-minded fairies who use their bonded Princesses to follow the Fairy Queen’s commandments of prim, ladylike conduct in the face of any threat, are particularly popular. The Princesses tied to this organization typically pay great attention to proper conduct, whether in a court or on a battlefield, and as a result possess a great deal of tactical magical abilities. Princesses who are driven by the ideals of the Fairies and who seek to be a paragon of their cause often flock to this path. The Pale Maidens, a loose association of like-minded fairies who seek to help Princesses pursue true love and a happily-ever-after, are a common choice for those who wish to live the magical life of their dreams. Such Princesses possess strong magic, much of it tainted with love and psychic influence, at the cost of their ability to participate in combat beyond supporting. Princesses who do not believe in violence, want true love, and care about beauty often see the importance of this philosophy.
13123222.title: Something Else

1313.content: Is it a member of the group, or someone else entirely?
1313.title: Someone Else

13131.content:
Though some of the party members came to the school to learn, some had other plans to make use of their time, either not taking interest in the school's classes or for some other reason. Perhaps:

Arthur, believing himself incredibly wise and smart thought himself above instruction at this point thought he would get more out of the school by acting as a teacher or tutor for the dumber and ditzier students who had the coin to pay. Hoping for the chance to make a quick buck while enlightening others of his brilliance, he will soon discover he is the one who will be learning a lesson.

or perhaps...

Harry, never much of a student, he would rather chase skirts and drink spirits then waste time at school. As fate would have it, Harry unknowingly unlocks a Prestige class quest that begins to subtly change him.
13131.title: Misadventures of the Party members

131312.content:
Primer - Prestige classes are unique, highly specialized classes that require specific requisites to be fulfilled before they can be unlocked. However, what a prestige class can be can range from something extremely rare and technical to something incredibly ubiquitous or mundane to something even as specific as something hereditary, such as an Elf.

During his prowl for drinks and beautiful women, Harry ends up on the path of a prestige class without even realizing it and unbeknownst to him changing meet the class's requirements. The quest is called...
131312.title: Harry and the prestige quest

choices: Gurruhk is given a new and unwanted career...
13132.content:
Is it...

Gurruhk?

Gurruhk, a proud half-orc barbarian from the southern wilderness, lives to destroy and to conquer. Possessing above-average strength and combat skill, he has never found true opposition as he has never encountered a truly powerful foe. Or, at least, he hadn't until he decided to try kidnapping slaves in a city with an actual guard force. Quickly caught and condemned to jail, his misogynistic and hateful comments to the female Vigiles in charge of his imprisonment condemned him to re-education at the Grand Institute for Resolute Leaders (previously Resolute Ladies). Gurruhk sees the sentence as another example of slap-on-the-wrist female weakness, but once he finds what his enforced new role is, he might realize he would have preferred the executioner's block...
13132.title: Someone Else

choices: Must find the Elixir of Strength
Must search for the Cheese of Longevity
132.content:
One fine and sunny day, the five adventurers were bored.
"Arther," Harry responded while drawing a lot from a nearby hat, ignoring the cackling local witch, "So, we have spent 3 hours debating and we still haven't come to a conclusion". Suddenly Gore nabbed the paper from Harry quickly and read it aloud to the group.
"M-must look at board!" Gore exclaimed. Blank stares met Gore's sunken eyes.
"What?" replied Samuel, leaning on his healing staff.
"I think Gore said we must look at the quest board over there," responded David the knight in a rather goodhearted, translating Gore's gibberish was a pastime of his.
"Tally-ho, I suppose we will look at the questboard," sighed Harry before glancing at the quest-board situated in the town's square, "Can any one of us read?"
""
132.title: They take a strange request from the questboard

choices: Investigating the Forest of Scattered Light
Checking the abandoned town near the witch's house
1323.content:
"Find the Stoat of Wisdom. A curious request, wouldn't you say?" Arther read to his compatriots.

"The hell's a stoat?" sighed Harry as he took a swig of his drink.

"Toad, dumbass." jeered Gore with confidence.

"No, a stoat is a type of weasel, a rodent. Not an amphibian." Arther quickly corrected, Gore already trying his patience.

"Harry, how don't you know what a stoat is? Your'e an hunter!" cried Samuel.

Harry took another swig before answering, "Firstly, I'm the former royal archer for the Grand Duchy of Eielwell, not a hunter. Second, Why the hell would I hunt a tiny rodent and not a wolf or a bear? And Fourthly, do you not see this mead in my hand right now?"

"Harry, that's only three things." He countered.

"Mead counts for two, white shirt." Harry cackled as he took another swig.

"Damn Straight." Gore happily nodded as he gave Harry a high-five.

"Alright enough!" David announced crossing between Harry and Samuel. "Arther, does it say who the client is?" David turned, trying to get everyone back on track.

"Yes, the client is... Meradele, the Witch of Painted Nightshade. Apparently, the stoat is her familiar. Befitting a powerful witch, I suppose." Arther explained, a twinge of curiosity present in his tone.

"Great. Having someone like her owe us is a plus, witches tend to reward quests with their unique creations. Plus we might just learn something else along the way. Let's head out." David said optimistically as he headed for the door. "We'll search its last known locations and work from there."
1323.title: Find the Stoat of Wisdom

14.content:
You are Thomas Williamson, a 14 year old boy. You have quite a big family with 4 siblings you have to deal with. You are fairly average, but a bit meek and not much of a public speaker. Definitely not an eloquent speaker, these reasons cause you to often try and be pushed around by your family and others. It seems that you can barely ever win in an argument. Your little sister Anna is 9 years old and your typical bratty girly girl. She is always playing dress up, and having tea parties while trying to drag anyone she can in. Your little brother Tim is 11 years old is always hyper and loves to play loudly with his toys. Then you have your twin sister Jennifer who is quite mischievous and loves playing planks. She constantly tries to get you roped into her schemes that never work out well for you. Since you have little space in the house and your younger siblings and older sister usually get special treatment, you have to share a room with her. You are always getting into arguments with her about how to decorate it, or her trying to get you to move into someone else's room.

Your older sister Taylor was the worst at bossing you around. She is a 16 year old girly cheerleader who tries to get all her siblings to do her work for her. She has an overflowing closet of clothes and constantly weasels people out of money so she can shop more. As for your parents, there is your father Dave who is gone a lot for his job, and is a workaholic. Your mother Courtney spends most of her time taking care of the house and trying to get her children to help out. Just like Taylor, she is very trendy and a little bit of a shopaholic.

With all these bossy family members, you were constantly getting into arguments. They weren't too much of a problem until one day you woke up and your conversations mysteriously turned into turn based debates battles like in a videogame . You wouldn't learn about this and the effect it would have on your life until your first argument that day. You woke up and things were going smoothly as you prepared for school, but that day you first got into an argument with...
14.title: Persuasion Battle

141.content:
You were getting ready for school when you heard your older sister Taylor yelling for you. You were quite worried about it, your sister was normally fairly nice, but she could be pretty mean when angry. Deciding to bite the bullet, you left the room to see what she had to say. "You messed up my clothes! You put red clothes in with the whites." she yelled at you. Taylor had done you a favor a while back and in return she got you to do her laundry yesterday while she was studying. You were tired and not really paying attention. You were about to respond when something strange happened. Everything around you started to look like an 8-bit video game being made out of pixels. It even included your sister, but what was even stranger was text boxes that appeared in front of you.

>Argument Commencing.
>Taylor gains 20 points for Thomas's failure to wash clothes properly
>Taylor gains 10 points for knowledge of clothing
>Current Persuasion Control: 20% You vs 80% Taylor

All of this talk about persuasion, argument, and points was flying over your head. It was all so strange, and you just wanted everything to go back to normal. Looking around you saw another menu. It was an interface like one you would find in a RPG with different actions listed.

>Attack
>Defend
>Compromise
>Evade
>Escape
>Item

You had no clue what any of these would do and clicked on the one labeled. What came up was a text box telling you that you had no usable items. Trying to think of what else to do, you continued through the list. The only one that seemed like a good idea was the compromise one. You just wanted to get this all over with and clicked on it. A text box came up giving you a warning.

Warning: Successful Compromise will end battle, and will cause 5 point penalty

You didn't even know what the points meant, and just wanted the battle over with so you clicked again. Victorious 8 bit music was sounding through the air, signaling that the battle had been ended.

>Argument Complete
>You suffer from 5 point penalty due to Compromise initiation
>Final Score: 15% You 85% Taylor
>Taylor gains Major Victory

Terms of Major victory for Taylor are:
> Thomas apologizes for mistake
>Thomas pays to replace damaged clothing
>Thomas will clean Taylor's room tomorrow
>Taylor forgives Thomas

When the battle ended, everything seemed to return to normal. You were about to breathe a sigh of relief, but instead you were forced to say words against your will. "I'm really sorry about the clothes Taylor. I will even pay so you can replace the clothes. I can also help clean your room tomorrow to make up for it." You were shocked by what you were forced to say. "Alright, i guess I will forgive you this time little bro. Thanks for the help." Your sister responded as she left to finish her own preparations. You weren't sure what was going on, though you had a feeling that it wasn't going to mean anything good for you.
141.title: Taylor

choices: Fast forward to first day of Ballet
142.content:
Last night, Anna had asked you to record a show about ballet for her and of course you forgot.

Anna stomped over to you with a scowl on her face, "Tom! You didn't record my ballet show last night!"

Just then, it was as if the house merged and contorted until you found yourself face to face with a pixelized version of Anna standing in front of you with a text box below reading:

>Anna confronts you about the ballet show
>she gains twenty points of an advantage due to your failure
>Anna's knowledge of ballet gives her a five point advantage

Argument Commencing!
--->Current Persuasion Control: 25% You vs 75% Anna

'What the heck is going one!' you thought. Then suddenly another window opened up:
>Attack
>Defend
>Evade
>Compromise
>Run Away
>Item

The window reminded you of a large scale Pokemon screen.... 'Wait. Is this like final fantasy or whatever?' Curious, you clicked 'Attack' and then another list opened up:
>Blame Anna
>Mock Ballet
>Punch Anna
>Mock Anna

'Oookay, not clicking on that tab. Back. Back!' The same list popped open, This was strange but, you didn't really understand what any of this meant, what was Persuasion Control even? You clicked on 'Compromise' and a window popped saying:
Remember! If enemy agrees, compromising ends the battle.

'Great!' you thought and you pressed the compromise button again. Some strange victory music began to play as a window popped up:
>Anna agrees to Compromise. You lose 5 points due to Compromise initiation.
--->Final score: You 20% vs Anna 80%
>Anna gains major victory!

>Terms of Major Victory for Anna are:
--->Thomas apologizes and begs for forgiveness
--->Thomas will record the show next time
--->Thomas practices Ballet for a week
--->Anna Forgives Thomas

"What the he-" was all you could say as you were transported back to the living room. 'Weird. Everything seems normal' Anna was standing in front of you and all of sudden you spouted, "I'm sorry Anna. I'll record it next time. Also, can you give me some Ballet tips."

Anna nodded her head, "Of Course and I forgive you. Don't forget next time." She said with wink as she scampered off.

'What the heck just happened it was like I lost control of myself.' Panic flooded your mind. 'Was that because of the game thing? I don't know how or why but, I think my life just got a whole lot harder!'
142.title: Anna

1422.content:
Going through the rest of your day was difficult with that strange experience hanging over your head. You tried your best to avoid getting into arguments with mild success. A couple small arguments happened, but when the game came up you would just press Run away . It was the next day and now the weekend, "The perfect chance to stay in my room and not have to deal with it" you thought. You were mistaken as against your will you changed into your workout clothes and went to Anna's room. You remember that yesterday you were forced to ask Anna for ballet tips and the game like interface said you would practice ballet for a week. Confirming your fears, you told Anna you were ready for the ballet tips and she excitedly rushed over to start. It was mostly just an hour of learning stretches and exercises. When it was done though, Anna was looking over you carefully. "You can't wear that for ballet practice, you need to wear a tutu " she told you, not approving of your regular workout clothes. You disagreed and to your dismay the game started again.

>Anna confronts you on your clothes for ballet practice
>Anna's knowledge of ballet gains her 10 points
Argument Commencing!
--->Current Persuasion Control: You 40% vs Anna 60%

"Great" you thought. Anna had an advantage once again. It wasn't as bad as last time though. You scrolled through your options and clicked on Run Away. A text box appeared saying:
Escape has failed

You were horrified that it failed on you. It must of been because of the disadvantage you started with.

>Anna mocks your workout clothes!
A text box next to Anna appeared
Anna:[ You can't wear those rags for ballet practice! You need a real ballet uniform to do it best.]

>Anna gains 10 points for successful attack
>Current Persuasion Control: 30% You 70% Anna

Things had gotten even worse for you. You didn't know that they would attack back. Going back through your menu you clicked on Defend and looked what popped up.
> Defend against need to wear Tutu
>Cry
> Defend against embarrassing clothes
You picked the last one since you wouldn't be caught dead wearing a girly tutu. Like with Anna you saw a text box next to you.
You:[ People would laugh if they saw me wearing a tutu!]

You hoped that this would work out for you

> Anna challenges defense
Anna:[ Only I would see you wearing it]
> Anna gains 10 points for successful attack
>Anna gains 10 points or successful challenge
> Current Persuasion Control: 10% You 90% Anna

It appeared to you that if your defense failed then you would lose even more points. You didn't want to do anything risky as you might lose all your points. You had no idea what would happen then, and you weren't going to find out. You went back to choosing Compromise as you went through the warnings.
>Anna agrees to Compromise. You lose 5 points due to Compromise initiation
---> Final Score: 5% You 95% Anna
> Anna gains Major Victory!
Terms of Major Victory for Anna are:
---> Thomas lets Anna choosw his clothes for ballet practice
---> Thomas will watch ballet shows with Anna for 2 weeks
---> Anna accepts

Just like before you were whisked back to the real world and forced to say things. " You are right Anna, you can decide what I should wear when practicing ballet. Also I would love to watch some of your ballet shows with you" You told Anna. She smiled big and replied " That would be great, thank you!" With that you returned to your room and thought about what happened. It appeared if you lost badly you had to do something related to the original argument plus something extra. It made you really worry about what would have happened if you lost all your points. "This is only going to get worse, isn't it?" You thought to yourself right before you took a nap.
1422.title: Fast forward to first day of Ballet

choices: Testing the waters of the persuasion battle
14221.content:
You had gotten a couple of hours of rest when your body sprang to life and your mind along with it. You proceeded to walk down to the living room where it looked like Anna was getting ready to watch her sho- oh right!

"Hey Tom! I was just about to ask if you were feeling up to watching my ballet show with me." Anna said joyfully.

"Of course" you sputtered automatically as you sat down next to her. It seemed that once the requirements to do a task were made available, Your body would automatically attempt to complete what the lose conditions made you do.

"Pay attention, Tom. This will help you with practice." Anna suggested as if she was a teacher (which she kind of was at this point.)

"Allright." You said trying to avoid provoking her with a disagreement at this point. If you did, she would have probably gotten an advantage again.

In terms of things you were forced to watch, it wasn't the worst. After doing the stretches in tights and a Tutu, it certainly gave you an appreciation for how difficult it was. Anna clearly enjoyed the show and she had always been trying to get you to do this kind of stuff with her.

Later....
14221.title: Later that day

choices: Try and win with an item
142211.content:
Trying to avoid any more arguments that day, you locked yourself in your room before you fell asleep. It was the next day and you woke up with your body moving against your will again. You knew that it was time to practice some ballet while later that night was more ballet show watching. You entered your sisters room where she greeted you with a smile. "Ready for another day of practice sis?" you asked your sister. She was so excited to have one of her brothers spending time with her and being so interested in ballet. Having to wear a girly tutu and tights was incredibly embarrassing and quite hard to get used to. Now your sister was starting to teach you some basic stuff for ballet. It wasn't too bad, but you knew you still had a lot more to by the time the week was over. Your sister was constantly critiquing your moves and you tried your best to avoid disagreeing with her. It was going well until it ended and your sister suggested that you practice a couple hours on your own time to get really good at it. The thought of having to spend even more of you time on ballet made you lose control for a second. "I don't have time to do that" you told your sister. This of course dragged you into an argument battle with your sister.

>Anna asks you about extra ballet practice
> Anna gains 5 points for knowledge of ballet
>Anna gains 5 points for prior instructing you on ballet

>Argument Commencing!
>Current Persuasion Control: 40% You 60% Anna

This time you didn't have a major disadvantage like the other times. You thought about maybe trying to press Run Away again, but if it failed than you were going to waste your turn and get stuck in a worse situation. "Maybe if I win, then I can reverse all of this!" you thought. The hope of being able to turn everything around drove you to keep going as you wondered what to do. This time you would have to go on the offensive to try and gain some points so you clicked on the Attack tab.

>Punch Anna
> Mock Ballet
>Mock Anna

Going down through the options, you decided that the best one to go with was "Mock Ballet". You went to click on it hoping that it would work. A text box appeared besides you as your action took place.

You:[I don't have time to waste on a stupid sport like ballet, I am too busy with school]
It was a bit harsh, but you didn't want to lose again. Another text box came up telling you how it went.
>Attack successful. You gain 5 points
>Current persuasion control: 45% You 55% Anna

Getting some points for the first time was making you really happy. it was giving you hope that you could win this time. Now it was your little sister's turn, and you wondered what would happen. You saw a text box that said

"Anna Pleaded with Puppy dog eyes"
>Anna: [Come on Tom, it's a lot of fun and is really good exercise. Please just do it for me, i just want you to enjoy it as much as I do]

>Attack successful: Anna gains 25 points
>Current Persuasion Control: 20% You 80% Anna

You couldn't believe how many points you lost. Maybe your lack of debating skills was the reason you had such limited and weak choices. You certainty couldn't plead like your little sister could. It was clear to you that you would need to learn a technique of your own that could really convince and sway people into doing what you wanted. The situation had turned bad very quickly and now you had to make a decision. If you compromised now, then you wouldn't suffer a total defeat, but it was still a guaranteed loss. "It might not be over yet" you thought. You had never used the Item tab that you have seen before. It could be your hope to winning, but you could lose completely. After some thought, you decide to...
142211.title: The next day, more Ballet

1422111.content:
You click the [Item] tab hoping for something to get you out of this mess. An array of options then began to lay out in front of you: 3 Tabs labeled [Bribe/Gift], [Trade] and [Use] respectively with a list of items to choose from.

>Cash
'That sounded useful. Though given how things have been going it might not work, maybe even make her angry.'

>[Services?]
'What the heck?' clicking on the tab showed a variety of tasks you could do: cooking, cleaning, etc. 'Maybe I could use it with Trade and bite the bullet with one of these services. If it worked.....

>Playboy Magazines
'I can't believe this option is here.'

Many other options adorned the list but those were the first three that popped up. 'So my inventory is not alphabetized? Great.'
1422111.title: Try and win with an item

14221112.content:
"Maybe if I offer to do something for her, she will drop the issue." You decided that the best choice was to make a deal with her,hopefully it goes better than a compromise. Scrolling down the list you click on Trade and go to cleaning. You hoped it worked or else you were going to lose this argument badly.

>Anna accepts trade
>Anna obtains Victory!
>Terms of Victory for Anna are:
--->Thomas will clean Anna's room for the whole month

As usual now that the argument was over, you were whisked back to the real world and forced to follow the commands. "Alright Anna, I won't practice by myself, but I will clean your room for a whole month in exchange" you told her, wincing at what you were going to have to do. "Sure that's great!" Anna said while bouncing up and down. Now she had less chores to do. "Well this is just great..." you thought to yourself. Being stuck with cleaning her room meant more chances to get into further arguments with her. Plus she would be constantly hounding you to do more girly stuff with her while you were stuck in her room cleaning it.With all these things piling up you had to do with your sister, it seemed you just couldn't get away from her. Still you had a horrid feeling that soon you would be spending even more of your time with her.
14221112.title: >[Trade] [Service?] Cleaning

142211121.content:
It wasn't long before your first day of cleaning Anna's room came. When you were doing your own thing, it was just after Anna left her room that your body sprung into action. It moved to her room swiftly before getting to work.

You first began by picking up her dolls and putting them away neatly. You searched the area and found some discarded clothes, which you also picked up and transferred to the hamper. When you looked under her bed, you found it pretty crowded, so you reorganized it and put things back where they belonged.

You then moved on to dusting the room, your flexibility seemed to have improved due to the ballet practice but not much, though did try to use the skills if only to get done with cleaning faster. It was then you noticed Anna at the door.

"It's like you are my maid." she said with a giggle, clearly joking.

That, however, annoyed you to no end, "I'm not your maid."

Suddenly, the all to familiar sensation began to kick in.

>Anna called you her maid.
>First strike! You gain 10 points
>Shaky Defense: You are cleaning her room. You lose 5 points.

>Argument Commencing!
>Current Persuasion Control! 55% You vs 45% Anna

It was nice to have the advantage for once. You kind of wanted to press the attack to see if you could finally see a win, even if it meant taking the risk. Looking at the [Attack], [Defense], [Dodge] tabs, considered the best route to avoid losing points.
142211121.title: Skip to cleaning Anna's room

choices: Anna successfully counterattacks and wins the arguement
1422111211.content:
You decided that this time you were going to win this. You definitely don't want to lose again and see what happens this time. With that in mind you pressed your advantage and attacked.

>[Attack] Is is rude to call your brother a maid when he is helping you.

>[Defense] It was just a joke

>Attack successful you gain 10 points.
>Current Persuasion Control: 65% You v 35% Anna

If you could just win the next attack then you should be able to win it. With that you chose to take a risk and attack one more time.
1422111211.title: [Attack]

14221112111.content:
>[Attack] Even if it was a joke, you should think about how mean it is to call someone a maid when they're being kind enough to clean your room.
>[compromise] Anna is offering a compromise
[Accept] or [Decline]
Of course, feeling happy to having winning your first won argument like this, you push [Accept]

>current persuasion control: 70% you v 30% Anna

Terms of victory
>Anna apologizes for calling you a maid
>Anna stops teasing you when you are cleaning her room
>amount of service time lowered

As the battle closed out you were relieved,to find that you didn't lose control again and it was,Anna this time apologizing.
"I'm sorry, your being really nice with cleaning my room without complaining or anything. I shouldn't have teased you like that. Since I was such a meanie you can have a,week off of the month." She said, looking you in the eyes to show she was,sincere. "You can keep working I just want to watch." She continued, sitting on her bed as she,watched you work. You didn't acknowledge her presence however, trying to avoid an argument and still in shock that you had won. After about 20 minutes later, having to listen to Anna give tips for ballet the entire time may I add, you were finally finished and left to chill in your room a bit. Life however, didn't agree as before you got there you encountered...
14221112111.title: You win the arguement

14221112112.content:
You decided to press the attack.

>[Attack] Because of you I have to sit hear and clean your room instead of doing things I want to!

>[Defense] "Anna starts to cry" I just wanted to spent a little bit more time with you. Why are you so rude?

>Attack unsuccessful you lost 45 points.
>Current Persuasion Control: 20% you v 80% Anna.

You were caught off guard by this. You didn't expect her to cry. Not only were you angry because you were losing (again) but also your sister was crying. The time was passing by and you didn't know what to do. Eventually the time run out. Anna attacked.

>[Attack] You could try to be nicer.

You chose to defend.

>[Defense] I am trying. You aren't making it easier.

>Defense unseccessful you lost 20 points.
> Current Persuasion Control: 0% You v 100% Anna.
>Anna obtains the victory!

You couldn't believe your eyes. You lost. Again. But this time it was utter defeat. You didn't have any point left at the end. You were scared of the outcome.

>Terms of victory for Anna are.
-> Thomas will apologize for being rude.
-> Anna can call Thomas his maid while he his cleaning her room.
-> Thomas will dress as Anna wants to while clearing her room.

It was over. The battle ended. Now back to the real world. "I am sorry for being rude Anna, forgive me." Anna stopped crying and looked at you. "It's ok." she said. "From now, you can call me your maid when I'm cleaning your room." smile appeared on her face. "And I will wear dress in whatever you give me while doing it, to make it back for being so mean." You said against your will. When you were done speaking, Anna was giggling once again. "That's wonderful! Wait while I go get outfit for you... maid." she smiled and went out of the room. You were standing still, waiting for her to comeback with your new outfit. Soon enough she was back and you saw her holding...
14221112112.title: Anna successfully counterattacks and wins the a...

142211121121.content:
Your eyes widen as you see that she's holding a French maid uniform, not unexpected by any means, but still surprising. It's a traditional black dress with a white apron on the front with with frills going along the hem of the dress, which is just long enough to to cover up the layer of petticoats under it. You also see in her other hand that she's holding a pair of low inch heels, stockings, and finally like a crown jewel to top it off, a,signature maid hat. The sound of Anna giggling snaps you out of your shock as she starts to walk towards you.
"Here is the outfit you shall be wearing while cleaning my room." She said cheerfully as she handed you the maid outfit and the accessories. Like with everything else the game forces you to accept it and go to the bathroom to put it on, after making you thank Anna of course. "Oh wait!" You hear Anna say as she comes after,you.and gives you something else. "I almost forgot to give you this" she said as you take a closer look and realize it's a Black choker.
"Thank you, Anna." You say as you start walking back to the bathroom to change, not wanting to get into another argument with her at the moment. After getting into the bathroom you lock the door and start unfolding the uniform before realizing that she had also included a pair of frilly panties. It was then that once again lost control and felt your body start to strip down to start putting, giving you time to start reflecting on your choices. If you had chosen to just compromise when you had an advantage it might have gone in your favor, but you had gotten cocky. You also started to realize that if you wanted to get out of this you had to get better, start doing it more strategically. It was at that moment that you had now been given back control over your body again, looking in the mirror you quickly look away out,of embarrassment. You then decide to hurry back to Anna's room to finish so you could get out of this outfit sooner. However, as soon as,you got out of the bathroom you ended up face to face with...

1433.content:
She gave you a look of surprise asking, 'if it was really okay for to decide?'

You were forced to say yes, but she just as quickly told you she would handle everything herself later, so you just had to wait and see. That made you nervous more than anything else. 'What could she be planning?' you wondered as you came back to your room some time later.

Seeing Jennifer, with that big grin on her face was never a good sign and your fears were confirmed when you looked at the room, Jennifer's side looked normal for the most part, normal for a girl her age. Your side, however, was not so fortunate. Your bed sheets and pillows had been replaced with Disney princess theme, your side of the wall, which had formally been blue, had been painted a pastel pink that now finally matched Jennifer's side. The bed side table was now white with wooden flowers crawling up the legs with a pink music box on top and she had even gotten you your own girlish vanity table, though yours seemed more tailored to a younger girl.

You turned to Jennifer, giving her a big stink eye before sighing, "You let Anna redesign the room, didn't you?"

"Yep", she replied as she burst into one of her laughing fits. You wanted to yell at her but like before, the results from that weird argument battle were holding you back. At least, she didn't mess with your clothes. If just left the room like this for a couple days might be able to get the old style after Jennifer has had her fun.

Later...
